pull.title: add benchmark for block/undo file reading/writing

events.message: add benchmark for block/undo file reading/writing

events.body: This is very spammy though, compared to normal -benchmark...
@sipa Many blocks, many entries in debug.log, yes... what do you suggest?
I don't know, maybe add a specific benchmark option for this?

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4001_e21efd5de061cd005385932d3058b79323e4b217/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
I'm not convinced of the need of adding per-function benchmark functionality to bitcoind. In principle the same (and better) could be done with a profiler.
@sipa If you agree @laanwj you are free to just close this, so we can go on :).
Yeah, I think there's little benefit here.
